intro: Harpalyce pringlei, commonly known as Pringle's harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Harpalyce pringlei plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and stabilizing soil in its native range.
